column3: Listen up! Wisdom is calling out, understanding is raising its voice.
At the highest point along the road, where the paths meet, wisdom takes its stand.
Beside the gates at the entrance to the city, wisdom cries aloud:
I'm talking to you, people! I'm calling out to everyone!
You simple ones, learn to be smart! You fools, get some common sense!
Listen, because I have important things to say. Everything I say is right.
My words are true, and I hate lies.
Everything I say is honest and fair; nothing is twisted or crooked.
My words are clear to anyone with understanding, and easy to see for those who know what's right.
Choose my instruction over silver, and knowledge over gold.
Wisdom is more valuable than rubies, and nothing you desire compares to me.
I, wisdom, live with understanding and possess knowledge and good judgment.
To fear the Lord is to hate evil; I hate pride, arrogance, evil behavior, and twisted words.
I offer guidance and success; I understand and have power.
Because of me, kings reign, and rulers make just laws.
I give wisdom to princes, nobles, and all who judge fairly.
I love those who love me, and those who search for me will find me.
I have riches and honor, enduring wealth and justice.
My gifts are better than pure gold or silver.
I walk in the path of righteousness, along the way of justice.
I make those who love me rich and fill their treasuries.
The Lord created me at the beginning, before his works of old.
I was formed long ages ago, at the very beginning, when the world began.
I was born when there were no oceans, no springs overflowing with water.
I was born before the mountains were settled in place, before the hills.
I was born before God made the earth, the fields, or even the first dust.
I was there when he set the heavens in place, when he marked out the horizon on the face of the deep.
When he established the clouds above and fixed securely the fountains of the deep.
When he gave the sea its boundaries so the waters would not overstep his command, and when he marked out the foundations of the earth.
Then I was the craftsman at his side. I was filled with delight day after day, rejoicing always in his presence,
rejoicing in his whole world and delighting in mankind.
Now then, my children, listen to me; blessed are those who keep my ways.
Listen to my instruction and be wise; do not disregard it.
Blessed are those who listen to me, watching daily at my doors, waiting at my doorway.
For those who find me find life and receive favor from the Lord.
But those who fail to find me harm themselves; all who hate me love death.
